title: Rangers and Hearts both left frustrated after disappointing draw at Tynecastle
text:
Heart of Midlothian 1 Rangers 1

Tynecastle was the scene of frustrated hopes for both Hearts and Rangers on an afternoon of largely forgettable football. Craig Levein’s players were unable to break the sequence that has seen them fail to win a home league game since March, while the Ibrox side could not regain top spot in the table, edged out of their grasp by Celtic the previous day.

The most accomplished moment was born of an error as early as the fifth minute when James Tavernier made a hash of an interception – not for the first time this season – and merely diverted the ball into the path of Jake Mulraney, whose shot was beaten out by Allan McGregor.

The rebound fell to Ryotaro Meshino and the Japanese midfielder, on loan from Manchester City, lobbed precisely over the stranded Rangers goalkeeper to trigger long-awaited euphoria amongst the Jambo faithful.

Hearts deserved as much for a forceful start that caught the visitors completely cold and very nearly brought an even quicker reward when a cross from Sean Clare was met by Uche Ikpeazu with a curling header which beat McGregor but slapped back off the crossbar.
description: Tynecastle was the scene of frustrated hopes for both Hearts and Rangers on an afternoon of largely forgettable football.
